question: Your friends would describe you as:
ans: Chill. I’m pretty laid-back.
Loyal. I never turn my back on anyone.
Enthusiastic. I get excited about everything.
Strong-willed. I know what I want.

question: What do you value most in life?
ans: Kindness. It doesn’t take much to be nice.
Fairness. Things should always be equal.
Happiness. Everyone deserves to smile.
Attentiveness. We should focus on the present.

question: You’re in an Escape Room. What’s your team role?
ans: Follower. I’m just here for a good time.
Peacemaker. We should all come out as friends.
Mood lifter. This should be fun, after all!
Leader. I like to be in control.

question: What do you look for in a partner?
ans: Honesty. I expect someone to be truthful, no matter what.
Harmony. I want to find my missing puzzle piece.
Optimism. I don’t need someone raining on my parade.
Patience. I need someone willing to put up with me.

question: Which option best describes your dream vacation?
ans: A week at a resort, lounging or doing whatever.
A weekend camping and hiking the Redwood Forest.
A day sunbathing on the beach with a Piña Colada.
A week at a theme park where I make the itinerary.

question: What’s your biggest pet peeve?
ans: Lying. It just causes problems.
Privilege. People should start on the same playing field.
Pessimism. The glass doesn’t always have to be empty.
Laziness. I hate it when people sit around all day.

question: It’s the weekend—yipee! What’s on your to-do list?
ans: Watching movies. It’s time to kick back and relax.
A picnic in the park. Got to digitally detox from the week.
Visiting all my friends. We’re going to have so much fun!
The gym. I’m going to beat my deadlift record.

question: If you could have a superpower, what would it be?
ans: To freeze time. Sometimes I wish life would slow down.
To be good at everything I do. Does that count?
To mind control. I just want people to be happy.
To throw fireballs. It would look so epic.

question: What motto do you relate to the most?
ans: “It’s all about finding the calm in the chaos.”
“I can do hard things.”
“Try to be a rainbow in someone’s cloud.”
“When there’s a will, there’s a way.”

question: What’s your favorite part of the day?
ans: Midnight. There’s something so peaceful about the dark.
Early evening. The world seems brighter under the setting sun.
Morning. Who knows what amazing things are in store!
Afternoon. It’s when I feel the strongest.

question: Your friend failed a test. How do you comfort them?
ans: Hug them and surprise them with their favorite treat.
I pat them on the back and tell them it’s only fair.
Smile and tell them that they will ace the next one.
Diss the teacher. They probably failed my friend on purpose!

question: What’s your fatal flaw?
ans: I look after others instead of looking after myself.
I strive to be perfect.
I pretend to be happy, even when I’m not.
I’m too ambitious for my own good.
